title: JUMP/Lime contracts

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: JUMP/Lime contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all contracts, communications, and agreements as well as contract dissolution, related to the City of Davis's partnership with the bike and electric scooter share, JUMP, later rebranded as Lime. I am interested in all contracts and agreements between January 2018 and March 2023. This includes (but is not limited to):

• all contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits)
• insurance agreements
•  the October 2018 City Council urgency ordinance prohibiting motorized scooter share programs in the city
•  the terms of the agreement reached between SACOG and Lime for the City of Davis in 2022
•  the dissolution of any such agreement between the City of Davis and Lime in 2022 or 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Kent

communications.subject: [Document Released] City of Davis, CA public records request #23-270
communications.communication:
City of Davis, CA ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #23-270 along with the following message: This is the City’s initial response to your public records request received on October 16, 2023, for all contracts, communications, and agreements as well as contract dissolution, related to the City of Davis's partnership with the bike and electric scooter share, JUMP, later rebranded as Lime between January 2018 and March 2023.   The City has located records responsive to your request and they are being provided to you via the City’s public records request management system, NextRequest, under the "Documents” tab.   The City’s search and review of potentially responsive records is ongoing.   Pursuant to Government Code section 7922.535(b), the City is taking a 14-day extension in which to conduct this search and review. The City reserves the right to withhold and/or redact any records or information that may be exempt from disclosure under the Public Records Act, and/or other applicable legal privileges including, but not limited to, attorney work product, attorney-client privileges, and deliberative process.   This response is being sent within ten (10) days of the city’s receipt of your written request, and is, therefore, a timely response under Government Code section 7922.535(a). Our next response will be on Thursday, November 9, 2023. If you have any questions pertaining to this response, please contact the Davis City Clerk’s Office at (530) 757-5648. * ORD 2540 - Urgency Prohibition of E-Scooter.pdf * ORD 2529 - Bike Share Ordinance.pdf * Amendment 2_Program Agreement_Lime_SACOG Contract (12 31 20).pdf * Regional Bike Share Program Agreement SIGNED 5-9-2017.pdf * Regional Bike Share Program Agreement SIGNED 5-9-2017.pdf * SKM_C65817101214350.pdf * Amendment 2_Program Agreement_Lime_SACOG Contract (12 31 20).pdf Document links are valid for one month. After November 26, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Davis, CA.

communications.subject: [Document Released] City of Davis, CA public records request #23-270
communications.communication:
City of Davis, CA ************************************************************************ A document has been released for record request #23-270 along with the following message: This is the final response to your public records request received on October 16, 2023, for all contracts, communications, and agreements as well as contract dissolution, related to the City of Davis's partnership with the bike and electric scooter share, JUMP, later rebranded as Lime between January 2018 and March 2023.   The City has located records responsive to your request and they are being provided to you via the City’s public records request management system, NextRequest, under the "Documents” tab. The City’s search is now complete.   The city has additional records responsive to your request, however, these records are exempt from disclosure under the following Government Code sections: * Government Code section 7922.000 [Deliberative Process Privilege] — authorizes a public agency to withhold an otherwise public record from disclosure when the public interest served by not making the record public clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure of the record. In this case, we have determined that the public interest served by not disclosing a portion of the records you have requested clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure of the records. (Times Mirror Co. v. Superior Court, 53 Cal.3d 1342, and 1347; Rodgers v. Superior Court, supra, 19 Cal. App. 4th at 479-480; California First Amendment Coalition v. Superior Court, 67 Cal. App. 4th 159, 170 (3 Dist. 1998)) * Government Code section 7927.500 [Preliminary drafts, notes, or interagency or intra-agency memoranda] * Government Code section 7927.705, [Attorney Client Privilege] which exempts documents from disclosure if they are “exempted or prohibited pursuant to federal or state law.” California Evidence Code section 954 and California Code of Civil Procedure section 2018.030.   Because the city will not provide the exempt records, the Public Records Act requires that notification of denial of any request for records either in part or in full must include the names and titles or positions of each person responsible for the denial. See Gov. Code 7922.540(b). The person responsible for this decision is Deputy City Clerk Victor Jaimes. If you have any questions pertaining to this response, please contact the Davis City Clerk's Office at (530)757-5648. * Request 23-270 - Records Release #2.zip Document links are valid for one month. After December 22, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Davis, CA.
Technical support: See our help page

title: Clearview AI contracts and policies (Miramar Police Department)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Clearview AI contracts and policies (Miramar Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Materials describing this agency's relationship with and use of products by Clearview AI, a face recognition company.

CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS
Any and all agreements related to the acquisition and use of this "software," algorithm, or program. This includes (but is not limited to):
• all contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits)
• data sharing agreements
• insurance agreements
• intergovernmental services agreements
• licensing agreements
• memorandums of understanding, and
• nondisclosure agreements
• any relevant Requests for Expressions of Interest, Requests For Proposal (or equivalent calls for bids), responses to Requests for Expressions of Interest, letters of interest, responses to Requests for Proposal, sole source or limited source justification and approval documentation, documentation of selection, and other materials generated in the consideration and selection of the technology in question.

FINANCIAL and FUNDING MATERIALS
• Any records related to the financing or funding of this face recognition technology or system, including a copy of any related funding opportunity announcements, grant applications, grantor status/progress reports, purchase orders, invoices, and other memoranda and documentation related to the payment or cost (or lack thereof) of the face recognition technology or system, related technology, personnel, equipment, or other elements concerning this face recognition technology or system or program.

POLICIES, INSTRUCTIONAL, TRAINING, AND USE MATERIALS
• All instructional materials, presentations, and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of face recognition technology or system. This includes any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of the software, any explanations (whether generated internally or externally) of how the face recognition technology or system works, and any other document that has been used to help explain the use of the face recognition technology or system to any party, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.
• This also includes training materials governing the use, sharing, or access to the face recognition technology or system or any data related to or collected by the face recognition software/technology, including the legal standard that is required before using the technology.
• Please provide a copy of any policies, policy directives, guidance documents, memoranda, training materials, or similar records governing the use and function of this technology for immigration, law enforcement, or any purpose, including all those related to data retention, permissible and impermissible use, and security standards. This would include materials that describe the application, function, and use of the face recognition technology or system, including advertisements, emails, handouts, usage policies, PowerPoint presentations, specification documents, or standard operating procedures.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alexandra

Subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Clearview AI contracts and policies (Miramar Police Department)
To Whom It May Concern: 
  
 Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records: 
  
 Materials describing this agency's relationship with and use of products by Clearview AI, a face recognition company. 
  
 CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS
Any and all agreements related to the acquisition and use of this "software," algorithm, or program. This includes (but is not limited to):
• all contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits)
• data sharing agreements
• insurance agreements
• intergovernmental services agreements
• licensing agreements
• memorandums of understanding, and
• nondisclosure agreements
• any relevant Requests for Expressions of Interest, Requests For Proposal (or equivalent calls for bids), responses to Requests for Expressions of Interest, letters of interest, responses to Requests for Proposal, sole source or limited source justification and approval documentation, documentation of selection, and other materials generated in the consideration and selection of the technology in question. 
  
 FINANCIAL and FUNDING MATERIALS
• Any records related to the financing or funding of this face recognition technology or system, including a copy of any related funding opportunity announcements, grant applications, grantor status/progress reports, purchase orders, invoices, and other memoranda and documentation related to the payment or cost (or lack thereof) of the face recognition technology or system, related technology, personnel, equipment, or other elements concerning this face recognition technology or system or program. 
  
 POLICIES, INSTRUCTIONAL, TRAINING, AND USE MATERIALS
• All instructional materials, presentations, and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of face recognition technology or system. This includes any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of the software, any explanations (whether generated internally or externally) of how the face recognition technology or system works, and any other document that has been used to help explain the use of the face recognition technology or system to any party, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.
• This also includes training materials governing the use, sharing, or access to the face recognition technology or system or any data related to or collected by the face recognition software/technology, including the legal standard that is required before using the technology.
• Please provide a copy of any policies, policy directives, guidance documents, memoranda, training materials, or similar records governing the use and function of this technology for immigration, law enforcement, or any purpose, including all those related to data retention, permissible and impermissible use, and security standards. This would include materials that describe the application, function, and use of the face recognition technology or system, including advertisements, emails, handouts, usage policies, PowerPoint presentations, specification documents, or standard operating procedures. 
  
 The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
  
 In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
  
 Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 
  
 Sincerely, 
  
 Alexandra

communications.subject: Records request Acknowledgment 11/9/23
communications.communication:
Greetings,

The City of Haines City is in receipt of your records request. Your request for records has been forwarded to the appropriate parties for response.  Please be assured your request will be addressed in the order in which it was received and will be produced within a reasonable amount of time.  Should this request rise to the level of "extensive" the City will provide you with a written estimate, of which a 50% deposit has to be paid, prior to commencement.  The City's records policy is attached for your review.

Also, be advised that the statutory obligation of the custodian of public records is to provide access to, or copies of, public records in a reasonable period of time, under reasonable conditions, and under supervision by the custodian or the custodian's designee.  However, Florida statutes do not require the custodian of records to provide information about the records produced or to create new records in response to a request.

The City is happy to comply with your request, and if there is anything else we may help you with, please let us know.


Lucia Santa-Cruz
Public Records Manager

title: Government Surveillance Documentation - Orange County Sheriff  (2020-2022)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Government Surveillance Documentation - Orange County Sheriff  (2020-2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear  Public Information Officer,

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking specific digital and physical documents related to government surveillance programs operated by the Orange County Sheriff's Office in New York. This request covers the period from 2020 to 2022. The requested documents include, but are not limited to:

Digital Documents:
a. Policies, procedures, guidelines, and training materials regarding the use of specific facial recognition software or hardware (e.g., Clearview AI, NEC NeoFace).
b. Records, contracts, and procurement documents related to the acquisition and use of license plate readers, including specific models or manufacturers employed by the Orange County Sheriff's Office.
c. Protocols, authorizations, and any legal opinions governing the use of cell phone tracking devices, specifically Stingray or any other similar tools utilized by the office.
d. Internal reports, assessments, or audits evaluating the effectiveness, efficiency, or impact of government surveillance programs.
e. Any emails, memos, or other digital communications discussing or mentioning government surveillance activities.
Physical Documents:
a. Manuals, handbooks, or printed guidelines outlining the permissible use of surveillance technologies by Orange County Sheriff's Office personnel.
b. Copies of agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with external entities regarding data sharing or access to surveillance technology.
c. Hard copies of reports, assessments, or audits conducted by the office or external entities regarding government surveillance programs.
d. Pamphlets, brochures, or printed materials used to inform the public about surveillance initiatives.
To ensure a comprehensive search, please include all relevant departments, units, and storage locations within the Orange County Sheriff's Office.

In compliance with applicable legal standards, I kindly request that you process this FOIA request in a manner consistent with the public's right to access information regarding government surveillance programs. Please note that the claim that disclosure would interfere with government operations must be supported by specific and demonstrable evidence.

Additionally, I request that you provide an index of any documents that are redacted or withheld in whole or in part. The index should include the title or description of each document, the specific exemption(s) applied, and the justification for each redaction or withholding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

communications.subject: [Records Center] SHERIFF FOIL REQUEST :: P000482-051723
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
RE: SHERIFF FOIL REQUEST of May 17, 2023., Reference # P000482-051723. 
Dear Jordan Lassiter: 
This letter will serve to acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request dated May 17, 2023 pertaining to: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

Dear Public Information Officer, 

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking specific digital and physical documents related to government surveillance programs operated by the Orange County Sheriff's Office in New York. This request covers the period from 2020 to 2022. The requested documents include, but are not limited to: 

Digital Documents: 
a. Policies, procedures, guidelines, and training materials regarding the use of specific facial recognition software or hardware (e.g., Clearview AI, NEC NeoFace). 
b. Records, contracts, and procurement documents related to the acquisition and use of license plate readers, including specific models or manufacturers employed by the Orange County Sheriff's Office. 
c. Protocols, authorizations, and any legal opinions governing the use of cell phone tracking devices, specifically Stingray or any other similar tools utilized by the office. 
d. Internal reports, assessments, or audits evaluating the effectiveness, efficiency, or impact of government surveillance programs. 
e. Any emails, memos, or other digital communications discussing or mentioning government surveillance activities. 
Physical Documents: 
a. Manuals, handbooks, or printed guidelines outlining the permissible use of surveillance technologies by Orange County Sheriff's Office personnel. 
b. Copies of agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with external entities regarding data sharing or access to surveillance technology. 
c. Hard copies of reports, assessments, or audits conducted by the office or external entities regarding government surveillance programs. 
d. Pamphlets, brochures, or printed materials used to inform the public about surveillance initiatives. 
To ensure a comprehensive search, please include all relevant departments, units, and storage locations within the Orange County Sheriff's Office. 

In compliance with applicable legal standards, I kindly request that you process this FOIA request in a manner consistent with the public's right to access information regarding government surveillance programs. Please note that the claim that disclosure would interfere with government operations must be supported by specific and demonstrable evidence. 

Additionally, I request that you provide an index of any documents that are redacted or withheld in whole or in part. The index should include the title or description of each document, the specific exemption(s) applied, and the justification for each redaction or withholding. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Jordan Lassiter 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Forange-county-sheriff-11389%252Fgovernment-surveillance-documentation-orange-county-sheriff-2020-2022-145831%252F%253Femail%253Dorangecountygov%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAA5fW43wi8RWWDHftwEiF5wLt4%3A1pzSL3%3AslrlRVKBldSKbR_7zfhaQ2V6oAM3Qn45Ae7ua3ItKxY" 
Please be advised that it could take up to twenty (20) business days to locate the records you seek, if indeed they are available and subject to disclosure under the Public Officers Law. We shall, of course, endeavor to have our search completed as quickly as possible. 
If you have any questions or need additional information, please reply to this email. 
Regards, 
Deputy Thomas Durso #115 
Orange County Sheriff's Office

title: Kenneth Walton

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Kenneth Walton
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records (including but not limited to those deemed potentially responsive to FOIA 1357159-000) relating to or mentioning Kenneth Walton, an official with the Federal Bureau of Investigation who galvanized the agency’s New York office against violent political radicals and entrenched organized crime bosses in the early 1980s. His death has been widely reported in the New York Times. See http://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/17/nyregion/kenneth-walton-fbis-bold-new-york-face-in-the-80s-dies-at-76.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously written
    about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000
    readers in outlets such
    as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, Unicorn Riot, and
    The Outline,
    among others. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and
    my editorial and
    writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on
    the files online and
    make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive
    and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my
    research is not limited
    to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and
    attitudes of the government
    itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of
    this particular subject in
    advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information to a
    broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v.
    Dep’t of Justice, 365
    F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d
    Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had
    “firm” plans to “publish a
    number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and
    national security policy."
    Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the requester,
    not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a
    representative of the news
    media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a
    representative of the
    news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which
    he or she is requesting
    information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the
    purposes of determining
    the appropriate fee category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and making
    the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.
    This request specifically includes both previously processed and previously
    unprocessed
    documents. If the documents are 25 or more years old and previously
    processed documents were
    processed before the 25th anniversary of the document’s creation, I request
    that in addition to the
    previous processed copy, the document be reprocessed and redactions
    reviewed.

Documentation Files

# Deceased Individual

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix ARN SSN FBI Number Date of
Birth Place of Birth Date of Death Additional Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Records (including but not limited to those deemed potentially responsive to
    FOIA 1357159-000) relating to or mentioning Kenneth Walton, an official with
    the Federal Bureau of Investigation who galvanized the agency’s New York
    office against violent political radicals and entrenched organized crime
    bosses in the early 1980s. His death has been widely reported in the New
    York Times. See
    http://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/17/nyregion/kenneth-walton-fbis-bold-new-york-face-in-the-80s-dies-at-76.html
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/86988/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fkenneth-walton-99154%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAj2MnNxOre1oSHteLnfMK20oc%3A1k0L6V%3AOooFXTFjVFh-dc6E8NCMO1PEcwQ

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Kenneth Walton
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 152 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 922 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,964 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Ghost Squad Hackers

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ghost Squad Hackers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files mentioning Ghost Squad Hackers AKA GSH, a politically motivated hacktivist team responsible for conducting cyber attacks on Central Bank's, Fox News and CNN, leaking sensitive data of The United States Military, leaking sensitive data of The Israeli Government, hijacking Afghanistan's Chief Executive's Twitter, etc.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process. title: Open Records Request: Martin

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Open Records Request: Martin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All email communications where Jacquelyne Martin is either the sender, recipient, CC'ed, or BCC'ed, sent between the dates of 1/1/2022 and 10/21/2023 and containing at least one of the following keywords: "Fusus", "Talen", "ShotSpotter" or "Flock." Please include any variations that are not case sensitive. Please include all email attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

title: Open Records Request: Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Open Records Request: Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release from Gov. Mike DeWine's office, the Cincinnati Police Department received a grant of $393,597.41 as part of the Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant program: https://content.govdelivery.com/attachments/OHIOGOVERNOR/2023/02/22/file_attachments/2416264/Violent%20Crime%20Reduction%20Program%20Grant%20Summaries%20through%20R12.pdf

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents for the Cincinnati Police Department's $393,597.41 grant as part of the Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant program described in the press release linked above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

RE: Open Records Request of August 20, 2023, Reference # P119385-082023 

The Cincinnati Police Department received a Public Records Request from you on August 20, 2023 for: To Whom It May Concern: 

According to a press release from Gov. Mike DeWine's office, the Cincinnati Police Department received a grant of $393,597.41 as part of the Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant program: https://content.govdelivery.com/attachments/OHIOGOVERNOR/2023/02/22/file_attachments/2416264/Violent%20Crime%20Reduction%20Program%20Grant%20Summaries%20through%20R12.pdf 

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents for the Cincinnati Police Department's $393,597.41 grant as part of the Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant program described in the press release linked above. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 

Sincerely, 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcincinnati-police-department-674%252Fopen-records-request-ohio-violent-crime-reduction-grant-151052%252F%253Femail%253DCPDRecords%252540cincinnati-oh.gov&url_auth_token=AAAatEzesKQOe49YzwlyvIT2J4g%3A1qXuXL%3AJW7j878HVaiXhs4iJPJiqeffEyqGpVGAZSUYHQM06go 
The Police Department has located records responsive to your request. 

The records have been released to the City of Cincinnati Public Records Center. You can log into the system by clicking the following link and download your responsive records. 
Police Public Records Request - P119385-082023 

Thank you. 

Records Section 
Cincinnati Police Department

title: IAPro internal investigations

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: IAPro internal investigations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the listing of internal investigations in IA Pro with columns:
 Occurred date    Case/CAD/Incident No    Employee ID/Serial number    First name    Last name    Date hired    Incident type    Allegation    Directive    Finding    Finding date    Action taken    Employee Type 

I request the listing be provided in Excel format so I can easily sort/filter it. Redactions should be done in Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Tacoma's Public Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Tacoma's Public Records Center! 
 
Your Login ID is:  152850-04971540@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://tacoma.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. 
 
City of Tacoma This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

title: Rat inspection program Commissioner's Orders to Abate, owner summons and city mitigation efforts

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Rat inspection program Commissioner's Orders to Abate, owner summons and city mitigation efforts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

* An electronic data file containing all Commissioner’s Order to Abate (COTA) issued under the city's rat inspection program. 
* An electronic data file containing all summons issued to property owners who failed to comply with a rat inspection COTA or other rat-related citation
* An electronic data file containing all instances when the Health Department treated a property for rats after the owner failed to comply with a COTA

I ask that all three files be released as flat files of comma-separated values in a simple database export from your tracking system. I request all of the metadata logged by your agency be included.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following New York Freedom of Information Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 27, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

communications.subject: RE: FOIL Control #: 2023FR00872
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Welsh:

The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene grants your Freedom of Information Law request with the above-referenced control number. Records responsive to your request are publicly available as follows:


* An electronic data file containing all Commissioner’s Order to Abate (COTA) issued under the city's rat inspection program.



COTAs are issued after failed initial inspections. Failed initial inspections are found by filtering the INSPECTION TYPE for “Initial,” then adding the RESULT filter for “Failed or Other R” or “Rat Activity.” Please see this screenshot for reference:

[cid:image001.png@01D98993.9F840ED0]




* An electronic data file containing all summons issued to property owners who failed to comply with a rat inspection COTA or other rat-related citation



Summonses are issued to all failed compliance inspections. These are found by filtering the INSPECTION TYPE for “Compliance,” then adding the RESULT filter for “Failed or Other R” or “Rat Activity.” Please see this screenshot for reference:
[cid:image002.png@01D98993.9F840ED0]





*An electronic data file containing all instances when the Health Department treated a property for rats after the owner failed to comply with a COTA



Data responsive to this part of your request is found by filtering the INSPECTION TYPE for  “BAIT, then adding the RESULT filter for “bait applied” or “monitoring visit.” Please see this screenshot for reference:
[cid:image003.png@01D98993.9F840ED0]


My apologies for the delay.

Sincerely,


Bernadette O’Donnell
Records Access Officer / Associate General Counsel
Office of the General Counsel
NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene — City of New York
42-09 28th St., Long Island City, NY 11101
Email: bodonnell1@health.nyc.gov<mailto:bodonnell1@health.nyc.gov> | nyc.gov/health<https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/index.page>

[cid:image004.png@01D98993.BB5814D0]

title: Sonny Barger FBI file

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sonny Barger FBI file
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All records, including cross-referenced indices and ELSUR records, regarding former Hells Angels Motorcycle Club national president Ralph "Sonny" Barger (Oct. 8, 1938 - June 30, 2022). Proof of death is not required, as his death has been widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2022/06/30/us/sonny-barger-dead-hells-angels.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Bledsoe
communications.communication: You're not permitted to charge for the release as I am a member of the press, it is less than 5,000 pages and you failed to respond within the time period allowed by statute. Please process the file for full release, as-is.

communications.subject: FOIA request 1408874 (Daniel Bledsoe)
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

We're contacting you about the FOIA request you made for records concerning Daniel Bledsoe. As you probably recall, the FBI located approximately 1330 pages that are potentially responsive to your request. Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium (51-950 pages), large (951-8000 pages), and extra-large (over 8000 pages) sub-tracks based upon request size. 

Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing.  Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process. A review of your request determined that it is currently in the complex request large processing track.  Given our current workload and staffing levels, it may yet be a long time before you begin to receive material from this request.   

Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing and allow for a more timely receipt of the information you seek, as it could potentially place your request into a smaller, faster processing track.  This may also reduce duplication costs, if applicable.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request?  If so, I would be happy to help you to decide the best approach to take.  We could potentially narrow your request by date, or if you are looking for something specific, we could approach the scope reduction process in that way.

Please let us know if you would like to potentially reduce the scope of your request.  We can be reached via email at fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov, or you may call 540-868-1695, Monday - Friday between the hours of 7:00am and 3:00pm Eastern time.

Best regards,

FOIA Negotiation Team
FBI Information Management Division
540-868-1695

Need a status check? Contact FOIPA Questions (foipaquestions@fbi.gov).

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Bledsoe
communications.communication: I'm afraid I need the entire file. Can you please confirm that the fee request was made in error, and the Bureau will not be attempting to charge duplication fees for this request?

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Bledsoe
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

You were granted news media status for this request, therefore there should be no fees because the page count is less than 5,000. We will continue processing the request in full. Thank you for following up.

Best regards,

FOIA Negotiation Team
FBI Information Management Division
540-868-1695

Need a status check? Contact FOIPA Questions (foipaquestions@fbi.gov).

title: FCC IBFS SES - HSC

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FCC IBFS SES - HSC
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

In its frequency waiver requests for certain Satellite Earth Station (SES) license application filings*, applicant Harte Satellite Consultants states that "Grant of this waiver is in the public interest. This earth station will be part of a test and training network allowing U.S. government customers to acquaint themselves with the service in the United States prior to using the service elsewhere in the world. Grant of this waiver request is in the public interest as it allows for utilization of available satellite capacity to provide U.S. government customers with service for critical testing and training exercises."

*said SES license applications having the file numbers SES-LIC-20220125-00083, SES-LIC-20220125-00084, SES-LIC-20220125-00085, SES-LIC-20220125-00086, SES-LIC-20220125-00087, SES-LIC-20220125-00088, SES-LIC-20220125-00089, and SES-LIC-20220125-00090.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any supporting documents, records, or communications between the applicant and the FCC pertaining to the above statement made by applicant or otherwise supporting applicant's claim(s) of public interest.

If the FCC is in possession of additional records which are relevant to or otherwise pertain to a supposed business relationship between Harte Satellite Consultants and "U.S. government customers", please consider those responsive to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Landon Edwards

communications.subject: Communication regarding fees for FOIA Control No. FCC-2023-000373
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Edwards,
The FCC International Bureau has engaged in a search for responsive records to your FOIA request dated February 21, 2023 (FOIA Control No. FCC-2023-000373). You requested that "in the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request." Under Commission rules you are entitled to the first two hours of search time without charge. The search for any responsive records to your request resulted in 3 hours of employee search time at pay level GS-13, which would result in a fee of $73.00 (1 hour search time at GS-13 fee rate).
Please respond to this email within 10 business days to notify the agency regarding how you wish to proceed. The FCC's timeline for responding to your request will be tolled (paused) while we await your response on whether you wish to proceed with your request.
Sincerely,
Julia Malette

Landon Edwards

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FCC-2023-000373
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Malette,

Hope you're doing well. 

It has been around 7 months since I submitted this request (#FCC-2023-000373) with only one response from the FCC. I sent messages in FOIAOnline on 03/14/23, 03/22/23, 06/28/23, and 09/11/23, with no response.

Now, due to the shutdown of FOIAOnline, I am not sure what the status of this request is and whether it has "fallen through the cracks" or was closed by mistake. Could you please update me on the status of the request?

I appreciate your assistance with this matter.

Thank you,
Landon Edwards

Sincerely,

Julia Malette

title: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Sustained findings since 2017

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Sustained findings since 2017
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Tennessee Open Records Act, §10-7-503 et seq., I am requesting copies of records related to cases of sustained findings of police misconduct at the Internal Affairs of the Memphis Police Department, between 2017 and 2022. This includes, but is not limited to, documents, reports, multimedia, body-worn camera footage, arrest filings, and so on. It also includes all documents, notes, correspondence and memoranda evidencing sustained findings reports and investigations, and all communication and correspondence in whatever tangible medium between the officials, the victims and the overseeing agency.

I am requesting digital copies of all responsive documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Here, misconduct includes, but is not limited to:

Excessive (unreasonable) force – beatings, manhandling of people in handcuffs, improper use of Tasers, injuries inflicted by police dogs, improper use of deadly force, and other police brutality or disregard for the safety of suspects. It also includes, but is not limited to: physical and verbal abuse, restraints happening unreasonably, coerced or forced confessions, and sexual abuse and assault.

False arrests – pulling over, detention, questioning and searches conducted without any probable cause whatsoever, including cases of planted evidence, racial profiling and trumped-up charges of resisting arrest.

As per law, police misconduct records are public records and do not qualify for any exemption and are not listed as confidential records.

This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

The Tennessee Open Records Act requires a response time within seven days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at dilcia19@stanford.edu.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Dilcia Mercedes.

communications.subject: RE: Tennessee Public Records Act Request #W024427-011823
communications.communication:
Thank you for your response. I understand that your office is not able to provide a total cost.
Before we proceed, could you please share a breakdown of the estimated hours of labor and hourly cost that makes up that $350.00?

Could you also share what kind of data this will generate? Are we talking case records, spreadsheets, body worn camera footage?

I'll need to share this information with my organization before they can agree to payment.
Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: Tennessee Public Records Act Request #W024427-011823
communications.communication:
Dear records custodian,

This email is in reference to request #W024427-011823.

The last message I received from your office was: 
"In response to your records request, our office is taking the the following action(s). Per the custodian, ISB is unable to provide a total cost currently; however, the estimated cost to produce records responsive to your request is $350.00. If you approve this estimate and would like for the City to proceed with your public records request, please respond to this letter within seven (7) days from 02/23/2023. Otherwise, the City will consider your request withdrawn."

I responded with a few questions and never got answer back.
Please see my follow-up questions below and send a response at your earliest convenience:

"Thank you for your response. I understand that your office is not able to provide a total cost.
Before we proceed, could you please share a breakdown of the estimated hours of labor and hourly cost that makes up that $350.00?

Could you also share what kind of data this will generate? Are we talking case records, spreadsheets, body worn camera footage?

I'll need to share this information with my organization before they can agree to payment.
Thank you!"

Under the Tennessee Open Records Act, §10-7-503 et seq., I am requesting copies of records related to cases of sustained findings of police misconduct at the Internal Affairs of the Memphis Police Department, between 2017 and 2022. This includes, but is not limited to, documents, reports, multimedia, body-worn camera footage, arrest filings, and so on. It also includes all documents, notes, correspondence and memoranda evidencing sustained findings reports and investigations, and all communication and correspondence in whatever tangible medium between the officials, the victims and the overseeing agency.

This includes, but is not limited to, documents, reports, multimedia, body-worn camera footage, arrest filings, and so on. It also includes all documents, notes, correspondence and memoranda evidencing sustained findings reports and investigations, and all communication and correspondence in whatever tangible medium between the officials, the victims and the overseeing agency. 

I am requesting digital copies of all responsive documents. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Here, misconduct includes, but is not limited to: 

Excessive (unreasonable) force – beatings, manhandling of people in handcuffs, improper use of Tasers, injuries inflicted by police dogs, improper use of deadly force, and other police brutality or disregard for the safety of suspects. It also includes, but is not limited to: physical and verbal abuse, restraints happening unreasonably, coerced or forced confessions, and sexual abuse and assault. 

False arrests – pulling over, detention, questioning and searches conducted without any probable cause whatsoever, including cases of planted evidence, racial profiling and trumped-up charges of resisting arrest. 

As per law, police misconduct records are public records and do not qualify for any exemption and are not listed as confidential records. 

This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 

The Tennessee Open Records Act requires a response time within seven days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. 

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at dilcia19@stanford.edu. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Dilcia Mercedes.

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Open Records Request: Yost & Fusus
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata for email communications sent or received, including being CCed or BBCed, for Attorney General Dave Yost between the dates of 1/1/2020 and 9/21/2023 which include at least one of the following keywords: "Fusus", "grant" or "Controlling Board." Please include any variations that are not case sensitive.

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and if the email has an attachment. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please provide me the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: MPIA Request for ZEEVIC Working Group Membership Selection Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails and other records and communications related to the Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council (ZEEVIC) Chair selecting and naming the members, Chairs, and technical advisors for ZEEVIC Working Groups including the Working Group that developed the ZEV Policy Scorecard and the Trucking MHDV Infrastructure Working Group. 

If all or any part of this request is denied, I request that I be provided with a written explanation that includes the reason for the denial, the legal authority justifying the denial, and my appeal rights. If you determine that some portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide me with the portions that can be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lanny Hartmann

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for ZEEVIC Work Group Meeting Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking access to records related to the Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council (ZEEVIC) Work Group meetings held since July 1, 2023. These records include agendas, lists of attendees, and meeting notes as well as any other related records. I am interested in records from both the ZEV Policy Scorecard Work Group and the Trucking MHDV Infrastructure Work Group meetings, as well as any other ZEEVIC Work Group meetings that have been held. I am also seeking any records announcing the Work Group meetings as well as any communications inviting attendees or potential attendees. 

If all or any part of this request is denied, I request that I be provided with a written explanation that includes the reason for the denial, the legal authority justifying the denial, and my appeal rights. If you determine that some portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide me with the portions that can be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lanny Hartmann

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request #854784
communications.communication:
Thank you for your prompt response to my Public Information Act (PIA) request and for providing me with the estimated cost for fulfilling the original request. In light of the associated cost and to expedite the process, I would like to refine my request as follows:

I am now specifically interested in obtaining information related to the Zero Emission Vehicle (ZEV) Policy Scorecard working group and the Trucking Medium and Heavy-Duty Vehicle (MHDV) Infrastructure working group. More specifically, I am seeking a list of the ZEEVIC members appointed to each of these working groups by the Chair, as prescribed in the ZEEVIC Procedures.

Given the nature of this more targeted request, I believe it will take less than two hours of work to fulfill. Therefore, I anticipate that there should be no additional cost associated with this revised request.

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to receiving the revised information at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely,

Lanny Hartmann

title: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Florida Southwestern State College)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Florida Southwestern State College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf.  This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement. 

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

3. Any records (including correspondence) sent to the provided in response to Memo No. 23-021, sent on December 28, 2022 by Chris Spencer, Director of the Office of Policy and Budget, directing each institution of higher education to provide certain information by Friday, January 13, 2023.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Florida Southwestern State College)  PRR 23-7
communications.communication:
Good morning,

This email shall serve as the acknowledgment of your public records request for the following:

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf. This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement.

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

3. Any records (including correspondence) sent to the provided in response to Memo No. 23-021, sent on December 28, 2022 by Chris Spencer, Director of the Office of Policy and Budget, directing each institution of higher education to provide certain information by Friday, January 13, 2023.

 We will begin to gather the records and will let you know in advance if there is a charge associated with this request.

Thank you.


Linda Saunders
Administrative Assistant
Office of the President

[cid:image001.png@01D1D207.E2A911B0]

8099 College Parkway |Fort Myers |Florida|33919
Phone 239.489.9295 |Ext. 11295
Email:  linda.saunders@fsw.edu<mailto:linda.saunders@fsw.edu>



Please Note:  Due to Florida's broad open records law, most written communication to or from College employees is public record, available to the public and the media upon request. Therefore, this email communication may be subject to public disclosure.

communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

In response to your records request, we estimate that there will be a cost of $174.13 for 3.5  hours of personnel time.

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf. This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement.

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

This is an estimated charge for labor cost, and we will let you know in advance, if your request will incur additional charges.  Likewise, if the request takes less time, the College will refund you the difference of what you paid, and the actual time used to provide the record.

I have included an invoice for your convenience.  We can receive payment in the form of a check or cash (directly to our cashier’s office). If mailing, please mail to the address below, to my attention.  Once the invoice is paid, we will begin to prepare your request.

Linda Saunders
Administrative Assistant

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYSDOH: COVID Vaccine Redistribution Communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all emails to or from the following email address since 1/1/2018:

CovidVaccineRedistribution@health.ny.gov

Including any attachments or related forms transmitted as attachments or embedded in responsive email messages.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker
